Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: lawrence_97
Reviews.Content: Comfortable hotel with excellent quality and range of buffet breakfast, and a nice touch of complimentary sandwiches/cakes for the whole afternoon and evening. Room was comfortable, although quite small, but this may be common in Venice as this was our second trip to the city, and both times the rooms have been quite small. A good location to get away from the crowds without being outside of the main city centre. The Ca d'or waterbus stop on the grand canal is just 5 minutes walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location - Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: ChrisX2Woking_Surrey
Reviews.Content: Clean and beautifully furnished. We stayed in room 102 which is an executive bedroom. Had fantastic canal views and a definite 'wow' factor. Easy to find thanks to other reviewers comments. We took the water bus (Blue line) from Marco Polo Airport as described in previous views and found the hotel within 10 minutes. I don't think I passed any other hotel during our stay that I would have preferred to stay in, this was indeed the perfect location if you like peace and quiet, yet still being within quick walking distance from all the attractions. We booked our tickets in advance to see St Marks Basilica which only cost 1 euro per person but saved us about an hours queueing time. The bell tour was also worth the visit. All in all a very enjoyable stay - would certainly return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel, better location than at first glance”
Reviews.Author: OsloTripper
Reviews.Content: Short walk to Rialto, approx 25 mins walk to St.Marcus sq and short walk (provided you don't have heavy luggage) to ferry service for the airport. Very small, but cozy and well kept rooms, nice staff and a nice snack buffet with prosecco, juice and tasty ham and cheeses in the afternoon lifts the overall impression. As expected in Italy, poor wi-fi provided at a charge â‚¬3 for 30 mins. Just enough to handle e-mails, but not much more.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect - Just what you hope for on that once in a lifetime trip to Venice”
Reviews.Author: yoftby
Reviews.Content: Clean, beautifully refurbished, hotel in an old palace. Friendly, helpful staff. We had the canal-view suite, which has a large bedroom with en-suite bathroom/shower, lounge and balcony. I understnd the breakfast is usually complemenatary. There is an afternoon tea buffet; my partner thinks that's complementary too, but we were always out during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: troff_monster
Reviews.Content: We had a three night break in Venice, staying at Hotel Una. the hotel was excellent, very comfortable and an excellent breakfast buffet to set you up for the day. It is set about 100 metres off the main shopping street (Strada Nova) but as soon as you are away from the main street, it is very quiet and you're more likely to meet locals than tourists. Its about a 10 minute walk to Rialto, 15 minutes to San Marco, 2 minutes to the Ca D'Oro vaperetto stop and about 5 minutes (through a maze of back streets) to Fuendemente Nuovo vaperetto stop. I would highly recommend getting a multi day vaperetto pass and exploring all of the islands in the lagoon especially Murano, Burano and Torcello.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: julieg9
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights in January 12. We travelled as a family with two young children. The hotel is about five minutes from two vaparettos, Ca' Dor and Fundemente Nouve. So well placed for sight seeing. However we walked more than caught the boat. It is a lot easier to get the water-boat (blue line) from Marco Polo than getting a bus or taxi then vaparetto. Whilst we were staying there, they had no bar and building work / decorating being done. However that didn't really bother us. There is a free bar,during the day in the breakfast room - which renders the mini bar pointless in my opinion. Unfortunately we weren't told of the free drinks until the second night. We had arrived about 7pm on a Monday and it would've been really helpful to know that we could have got free water, milk, juice, beer, cake etc. We had an executive room on the second floor which was already made up for us with a huge double bed, a sofa bed as well as a travel cot and we still had plently of space. The furnishings were very venetian. We had air conditioning in the room which worked, but because it was January, it didn't seem to warm the room but it wasn't too cold. The windows opened up to overlook a tiny canal. The bathroom had a bathtub with shower and toiletries. The safe was free to use and tea/coffee facilities were also in the room to be used with the fridge. The room was made up each day and every evening we returned to find the curtains had been closed, the bed turned down and dirty dishes taken away. Breakfast was until 11am and apart from the last day, we pretty much had the room to ourselves. You had a choice of scrambled eggs, bacon, sausages, toast, rolls, croissants, fruit, yoghurt, cereals, juice, tea, coffee and hot chocolate. The staff were wonderful. We could not fault them. They were always friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. Always had a smile on their face and were always ready to help, ie, get hot milk for the children, phone for restaurant reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit delighted again”
Reviews.Author: Vanda9
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Venice for my partners birthday because we had such a lovely stay last time we booked into Hotel Una again this time with our 4 year old daughter. We were delighted again by the excellent level of service although the hotel was having some refurbishments done this didn't present a problem for us being up early and out sightseeing. The staff were lovely and recommended local restaurants which were great. We have fell in love with Venice and would not want to stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Angela C
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this hotel for my 40th Birthday surprise w/e away, in January. The hotel was in a lovely, quiet location by a canal and only a short walk (about 15-20 mins) or half hour Vaporetto ride to St Marc's Square. The room was lovely and quite spacious and provided us with everything we needed. The dining room was actually nicer than the official photos show and free snacks and soft drinks were available all evening until 11pm, which gave a welcome pre-dinner 'scooby snack' when eating later in the evening. The staff were very friendly and most helpful, which made us feel very welcome and they gave good information and ideas. The only downsides included the bar being closed due to some building work they were carrying out, which was disappointing as I particularly enjoy a pre-dinner drink in cosy surroundings before venturing out to a restaurant. Also, was woken early morning both days by a banging sound, which I think was the swinging doors of the dining room downstairs. Overall, an excellent hotel and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: MAEY
Reviews.Content: The room was beautiful and clean. The interior has the scent of Venice. There was no interesting view from my room but I would love to go back to the hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “A very, very special place.”
Reviews.Author: Squeeky_in_Guz
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a quick break to propose to my girlfriend and what more romantic place than Venice. Una Hotel Venezia was just one hotel that grabbed my attention. Although initially put off Venice because of the perceived transfer hassle from the airport, I was quickly put right by an amazing transfer from Marco Polo Airport to Piazzale Roma. You have options to transfer by bus or train but also by boat which is very cool indeed. You can get a 3 day travel pass for ease and it is well worth it. Thereafter you can hop on and off the water taxis to see the most of Venice. In order to get to Una Hotel Venezia I would recommend either the Blue Line boat from the airport to Fontemente Nove and then a quick 5-7 mins walk through the residential back streets (this will give you a really good insight into the local area) or bus/train to Piazzale Roma and then water taxi #1 to Ca' D'Ora and then a quick walk across Strada Nova and then to the corner of Fond. Pruili where you will find the hotel. Externally, the hotel is easy to miss, nestled within the rather weathered residential buildings in the Carrregio district. There is no ostentatious signage or grand facade - just a very discrete sign outside right next to the canal just off the Grande Canal. However, when you walk through the sliding doors you will be met with a stylish vestibule and charming front of house staff. We were offered an upgrade straight away and the room was absolutely delightful - well appointed, great facilities and very comfortable. True Venetian class! Locally, the area is blessed with loads of traditional restaurants and bars mixed in with a great selection of shops. Carraregio is mainly for the locals and sufficiently far from the tourist traps but near enough so you don't need to spend hours getting to the fantastic monuments and attractions. The Rialto Bridge is about 5 mins walk away from the hotel and given the proximity to the water taxi stop on the Grande Canal, everything else is within easy reach. The hotel will be happy to help you out with directions and route planning. Don't buy a tourist map from the airport - the hotel have a much better one free! We had an absolutely fantastic time. We did a tremendous amount in our short stay there and Venice was stunning. Will we be returning? You bet! As for my girlfriend.....she is now my fiancee ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: LLMM0208
Reviews.Content: Booked based on the Trip Advisor reviews and wasn't disappointed. We had room 401 for three nights which was the wooden beamed room you see on the hotels website. Beautiful room but like all bathrooms in Venice - very smelly! The staff at the hotel did their best to contain the smell which did help in the short term. The breakfast was one of the best buffets I have had in a european hotel and all the staff at the hotel couldn't do enough to help. We were really pleased with our choice, the location and staff were excellent - thoroughly recommend it!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mkinnuca
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 nights at the UNA in October. Great location. good breakfast included and very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing for couples”
Reviews.Author: mdpai79
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Venice as a couple. My wife and I travelled for our 5th wedding anniversary. We flew into VCE and took the water bus (Blue Line) to the Fondamenta Nove stop. From there it was a quick 5-10 min walk to the hotel. Make sure you have a Venice map with you, otherwise, you won't find it. You can buy a map at the airport or when you purchase your water bus tickets, they will give you one. Unfortunately, our luggage was lost by the airline, so upon arrival at the hotel the receptionist was very accomodating and took all the airline/luggage information. They called multiple times daily to check to see if the luggage had arrived. After a quick check in, we were escorted to our room which is outside at another door and up a flight of steps. Room #4. The rooms, as any Venetian hotel room, was on the small side, but was very adequate for a night's stay. It was actually quite opulent for what I expected. The bathroom had a nice toilet, bidet, glass shower and sink. The steam pipes for heating towels did not work, but that is the only thing that was wrong with the room. Interestingly, most hotels in Venice save power by requiring you to place your room keycard into a slot at the door which signals the lights to turn on. That made me feel even more happy about the room, as I was saving power. There was no loud noises overnight and we slept comfortably. The next morning we ate at the complimentary breakfast buffet. They of course had excellent breads. The eggs, meat and other food was average. They did have free mimosas which was a nice way to start off our anniversary. Overall, I would go back to the hotel if I could not find a less expensive place. The cost was US$ 303 per night.

Reviews.Title: “perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: patric23
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to venice and this hotel added to our enjoyment. Perfect location, central yet quiet, great breakfast choice. Our room was upgraded so included a lounge area, and it was beautifully furnished and immaculate. Staff were happy to see you and the general impression was that everything was being done to make your stay as good as it should be. Room cleaned twice a day, a sweet on the bedside cabinet in the evening. The list goes on. We would certainly choose a Una Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service, amazing location!!!”
Reviews.Author: abc054
Reviews.Content: We came to Venice for a romantic weekend break. Upon arrival we were upgraded to a beautiful suite by a very friendly man. Also, we were offered complimentary snacks, cakes and drinks between 5pm-7pm.The room was very spacious, spotlessly clean and looked out onto the canal. The location - incredible!!! Quiet street with a 2 min walk to one of the nicest shopping/restaurant areas in Venice. Breakfast was very good in a cute, little breakfast room and had a wide choice. We were given two very good recommendations for local restaurants. On our last day, we woke up 20 mins late for breakfast. We called reception and they especially prepared breakfast for us in the lounge area. Amazing service that you would not get in many 5* hotels. Their attitude was very good. Overall, a wonderful experience and somewhere I would stay again if you're budget is around â‚¬200/night.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: vouna
Reviews.Content: Knowing Venice and its prices very well; this hotel was a very pleasant surprise (also because the Unaway chain of hotels is not one I would consider), For those who are familiar with Venice this is a fantastic location - very peacefull and just 2 min. away from the main drag.The hotel is a small tastefull restored corner building and offers a surprising good breakfast; the reception is vey helpfull and again for Venetian (spoiled) standards I wouldn't know of a better place to stay! Reading some of the remarks on tripadvisor I'm getting very irritated by those tourists who judge hotels by internet access, they have no clue what travel is about (and should leave their computers/facebook where it belongs - at home!)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in quiet location near to Vaporetto”
Reviews.Author: Deb1406
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Nice staff, comfy bed with choice of pillows, and breakfast included. Great loction near to airport water bus and Vaporetto in quiet canal/street. Is anywhere in Venice cheap? Hence our average value rating - we did shop around and this was the same price as other 4 *s.

Reviews.Title: “Bit diffucult to find the Hotel but it's really great HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Soo L
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights from Aug. 27th till 30th. I've seen the review on tripadvisor before booking this hotel and I was prepared with the help of google map, but when we arrived, even with the map it was bit diffult to find the place. You won't find proper sign with the name of the Hotel even in front of hotel gate. They just made the sign, which was printed out and really small. So it just look like a house, if you don't know the place. Beside this, everything was perfect. Increadibly "Clean room", spacious, good range of free amenities, professional staff always with big smile, perfectly arranged breakfast. Location is also perfect! Very close from Vaporetto station, close to best restaurants and small stores for quick stop for water, beer or whatver you need. Good walking distance to best attractions in Venice. If I'm visiting Venice again, I will definately stay at UNA, since now I know the exact location.

Reviews.Title: “A bit of home in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Singaporeconncection
Reviews.Content: I found the UNA hotel on Trip Advisor and it turned out to be the a good choice. As a woman traveling alone I am always a little concerned about where I stay. Others criticize the UNA for being away from the main attractions but I loved the Strada Nova as it was full of locals rather than the tourist mob you find closer to the main canal. I became a family member at a local restaurant recommended by the desk (sorry, can't remember the name!). I found it was an easy walk to everything I wanted to see and I loved being hidden away on a small street off of a small canal. I would give the hotel a higher rating but I actually didn't like my little room at first as it was on the first floor facing the street (if someone walked by they could peer in the window--luckily hardly anyone ever walked by) and my bathroom was like a travel trailer only faced in marble --the shower was just a curtain that you pulled around you while water ran all over the the toilet and sink. I thought of complaining as the first floor is a very poor choice for a woman alone, but I grew to feel comfortable in the coziness (cozy in that the double bed filled most of the room with an amoire and a table and chair. As others have noted the breakfast was great and there were snacks, beer, and drinks available all day long. The staff was also helpful. I would recommend you view your room before accepting it, otherwise I loved the UNA.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: abt9904
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic. It's a block or two off the touristy streets so it is quiet and you get a feel for Venice without the crowds. The check in staff spoke excellent English and was very helpful and friendly. A bellhop was waiting to take our bags to our room upon our arrival. The room was small by American standards, normal by European standards. It was clean and the bed was very comfortable. The breakfast was superb. My only complaints (and not really complaints, more like comments) were that we could not get the air conditioning to cool off the room as much as we would have liked and if you were very tall the toilet would be hard to use as it is pushed up very close to the sink. I would absolutely stay here again and would recommend it to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Venice Option!”
Reviews.Author: CJButterfield
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 6 day stay and couldn't have been happier with the room, the staff or the location. The superior room was a very good size by European standards. The breakfast was excellent and the staff couldn't have been more helpful. We used public transportation as per the hotel's website and it was a very simple process. Used a water taxi to get to the airport for an early flight and the front desk managed everything even checking on our pickup when it was not as timely as they thought it should be. I would definitely stay again. I'm a bit hesitant to give too good a review because they may be all booked up when I want to return!!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Christine_684
Reviews.Content: We flew in early for our cruise and we stayed at this great little hotel. It is in the Cannareggio area ~ so there was more locals than tourists! The little restaurants that were recommended by the hotel were fantastic (esp. when they can get you a reservation on short notice!) We enjoyed the breakfast each morning and for us with 2 teenage sons they were fully satisfied. Definately will stay here again on our next trip to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Travellin4ever
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Una for three nights in July. The location was fantastic. We were away from the busy and crowded tourist areas like St Marc's Square and the Rialto bridge, but close enough to walk. The Vaperetto is about a five minute walk from the hotel and we bought a 3 day pass and used it to go all over Venice. The staff at the Una were friendly and went out of their way everyday. Their breakfasts were delicious with great variety. We loved the Una but our only complaint was that for the price we paid (about $600 US a night), internet access should have been included.

Reviews.Title: “I felt scammed”
Reviews.Author: jmb27_11
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, good service, but I felt totally scammed. I booked the hotel online as a last minute booking as we decided to go to Venice for a couple of days while we were in Italy. When I entered the information for the days (three days Tuesday through Friday) we were staying it came up with what looked like a good last minute deal. The problem was that the deal was for the first turned out to be anything but. The price on the internet said $184 euros per night for a Superior room. I booked the room then logged off the internet as I was in another town in Italy and was about to run out of time for WIFI. As I arrive at the UNA Hotel, I am informed that only the first two nights are at 184 euro, but the last night is 261 euro. I was also informed that when I booked I only booked for one person which was not a problem, but it would cost me another 18 euro per night. Therefore, what I thought would be around $770 turned out to be almost $1,000. Obviously, that put me in a bad mood, but then when I went in the bathroom to take a shower, there was black hair in the bathtub. I was not happy. In any case, you should really be careful if you decide to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel, Lovely Trip To Venice”
Reviews.Author: Mumsytiger
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a two night trip to Venice with my family. The staff was extremely helpful and courteous right from the beginning! Our room was spotless and it was obvious that attention had been given to every detail. Easy walk to all attractions, gondolas, and water ferry. Grocery store very close by for extra snacks, drinks, supplies, wine! Included breakfast was ample and varied, and the breakfast room was never crowded. My advice - get out of the heat and crowds for the afternoon to relax in your elegant room - and come out for the evening to enjoy dinner on the terraces along the main streets! Very safe and clean area for family with small children.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Sparkling Clean & Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: Fetzel1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the 28-29 June for a short family break. Our room was the Junior Suite which is very nicely furnished and well equipped. The staff are extremely courteous and friendly. I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a good experience in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “The one hotel needed for your stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: jbwettergreen
Reviews.Content: I just came back from my stay in Venice and Una Hotel Venezia, and my overall experience is truly excellent. My trip was spontaneous, and was ordered four days in advance. First of all is this hotel is perfectly placed in Venice, at least after my personal taste. Located in a quiet district, south Cannaregio, but still just five minutes from The Rialto, and if you take the gondola and cross the Grand Canal, less than 3 minutes from the Rialto Market. The fact that they keep a 24-hour open reception is great, which I came to enjoy when my plane was delayed and I didn't arrive at the hotel until 1.00 am. This was no problem at all, and I was welcomed with a smile and an excellent understanding for english. On my way to my room I was informed about when and where the breakfast would be served, and everything I needed to know about the facilities of the hotel. Roomcleaning is applied twice a day, once in the morning and once in the evening. This is a very nice touch. It's delightful after a long day (I had been in for a shower in the middle of the day) to come into a tidy and clean room. It is also great to manually control the air-condition (possible to set to 0.0 celcius as minimum) if you are really hot from beein outside, which I was, and beeing able to cool yourself down in a matter of a short time. As for the interior, I love it. Not modern and minimalistic, but old-fashioned and baroquesqe, but not too much. It's greatly balanced. All in all this is a great hotel, and I won't think twice staying there for a second time. Actually I am that pleased that I won't even bother check for another hotel the next time I'll travel to Venice, which I will.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, brilliant staff”
Reviews.Author: apprendrelemonde
Reviews.Content: Hotel with quite but central location, with really nice staff - they know what customer service means. Nice banckground music in the rooms and corridors, good climatisation and nice furniture. Also breakfast was diverse and fresh. Quiet hotel, no voices or other disturbation from the corridor during the evening/night/morning. Only thing was a bit too little bathroom - the shower cabin itself did not let you stretch at all while shampooing your hair for example...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: marinhorserider
Reviews.Content: We spent 1 night at this hotel last week and can recommend it highly. The location is excellent - 3 blocks from the Grand Canal in an area with both shops and restaurants. The gondola to the market is close by and is only Euro 1 per person. It is about a 10 minute walk to the Piazza and there are lots of interesting stores and restaurants to look at. We were upgraded to room 203, a suite, it was wonderful - at the end of our trip we had a lot of luggage so the space was great. The bathroom was well appointed and there was even a kettle and coffee/tea in our room too. The water taxi knew the location so no issues with that. The internet access is Euro 3 for 30 mins - a good deal in Venice! The hotel has a lift and also includes a lovely breakfast at 7.30. Because we were leaving early they arranged for us to have cappaccino and pastries early. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice convenient hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: acoo6
Reviews.Content: We picked out the Una after reading trip advisor reviews, as we did for all our Italy hotels. The Una was well recommended and did not disappoint. It was quirky as many buildings are in Venice, with uneven floors, but the room was large and comfortable with a great bed. The staff were fantastic, without exception. They offered us good restaurant recommendations and couldnt be better. We arrived by train and because the Grand Canal was closed for a regatta our choices were to walk or wait. We walked from the station, and it was pretty easy to negotiate the streets. From the hotel we walked everywhere in Venice. Our only complaint, the Una was not cheap (Venice is not cheap, and I know there are many more expensive hotels), in fact was the most expensive hotel of our Europe trip, and yet was the only one without free Internet. I really think in 2011 you shouldn't have to pay extra for Internet in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Adam2S
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel! The staff were all extremely friendly and helpful. Breakfast was lovely. Rooms were nice and clean. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: cpsteward
Reviews.Content: I can thoroughly recommend this hotel - very welcoming, friendly and helpful staff, lovely, spacious room (we booked a 'superior'), excellent breakfast included. It's away from the main centre (just behind the main shopping thoroughfare), but just a 10-minute walk from the Rialto and 15 minutes from Piazza San Marco. It's in a very quiet, residential area, so no problems with noise. Also very easy to get from/to the airport by Alilaguna water bus from nearby Fondamente Nuova - much less journey time than from San Marco.

Reviews.Title: “Going back next year”
Reviews.Author: pavia
Reviews.Content: We took a suite in low season, early January. Worked very well with young family, double fold-up bed in living room, young children adored it. Very clean, spacious and friendly staff. Not sure that I could afford peak season, but that's true for anywhere in Venice. Would definitely go back

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, lovely decor.”
Reviews.Author: VivWestwood_fan
Reviews.Content: Really good hotel, no restaurant or bar, but the breakfast is fantastic and they do free afternoon tea with cakes.Reception staff really helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Reservation Issue with Una Hotel Venezia”
Reviews.Author: Shadya
Reviews.Content: We did review the hotels through tripadvisor before deciding on Una Hotel Venezia. We went directly to the hotel website and made a reservation for September 2, 2011. We had some special requests and asked if they would accommodate them via email. The hotel confirmed our special requests. Then the next day we received email asking us to book 2 nights. Apparently, this is customary with some hotels in Venice during the tourist season. I did explain that the hotel website made no 2-night stipulation. They reduced the first night 25%. We accepted this reduction. Then the hotel came back with another email asking for the credit card information that was previously entered at their website. Infact, they wanted us to email the credit card information. Beware of this hotel. We were able to upbook to a nicer hotel for one night, with transport to our cruise ship the next day. In addition, we reserved a large room with a three-course meal. Do not accept that all hotels book with a 2-night requirement because they dont.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and excellant staff”
Reviews.Author: Damian35
Reviews.Content: Once again TA has has provided us with excellant advise. The hotel was in a quiet location yet only a few minutes walk to the buzz of Venice. The hotel quality and staff were without fault. We would def stay here again and recommend to other.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel, short walk from main attractions in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Louise190726
Reviews.Content: We stayed in October 2010 for 3 nights. The hotel was very clean and quiet - we hardly saw anyone! Window looked out onto a very tiny canal with a building right opposite - I think that's the case with most Venice hotels. Lovely breakfast. It is a bit of a walk from the main attractions but quite close to the boat from the airport and to get to Murano. Venice is an amazing city. The one thing we found disappointing was the food was generally not outstanding and very expensive - paying nearly 100 euros for a very average meal for 2.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: michabella
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at this hotel. The rooms were appointed with Old World charm, but with brand new furniture. We even had our own separate living quarters upstairs, while the kids had a very large comfy pull out queen downstairs. After my trip, I realized I left several items at the hotel and they shipped them back to me in Florida. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: treadmanIndiana
Reviews.Content: Absolutely lovely place to stay in Venice. Great location-just a short walk to the main attractions and shopping. Rooms are gorgeous and spacious. Delightful down comforters and some of the most comfortable beds I have experienced in a hotel. Breakfast was lovely. Front desk hostess was so personable and helpful. We are returning in June and plan to stay here again! It is a little pricey but well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “This is an excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: BritinOzPerth
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay here. My room was comfortable, although the shower was a little cramped. The hotel was in a quiet position, but very close to a main thoroughfare. I would have no hesitation in recommending it, and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, very good and recommended, but a few minor concerns”
Reviews.Author: cadgwith
Reviews.Content: Overall, very good and recommended. Good aspects: Location away from main tourist sites made it very quiet at night (well, between midnight and 6.00 am, at least). Easy to get to from Grand Canal. Some good, and reasonably priced restaurants, cafes and cake shops close by, as well as 2 supermarkets. Very comfortable beds, and choice of pillows. Very clean, and smartly/elegantly decorated. 2 armchairs in room, plus table, so nice to sit there in evenings. Kettle, tea, coffee and dried milk sachets in room. Safe in room easy to operate. Breakfast good (apart from the coffee - see below). Free coffee/tea/soft drinks and snacks available some evenings. Staff polite and helpful, and spoke English. Effective air conditioning. Bedroom walls and floors/ceilings reasonably well soundproofed (but not doors or windows - see below). We were in room 104, directly above breakfast lounge, and overlooking entrance to hotel, and only once heard laying of tables c.6.00 am; we never heard water pump or front door. Only minor faults: a bit far from main tourist sites, so not that convenient to pop back to for toilets, coats, etc; doors and windows were not well soundproofed, so heard external noises (boat engines, people shouting, street cleaners, dogs, kids) and guests talking outside rooms (and outside entrance), up till midnight, and from c.6.00 am; some noise from air con fan; loud music (some light classical, but some awful Euro disco instrumentals) piped through corridors up until 11 pm, and audible in rooms ('though they did turn it down when I complained); staff sometimes slow to clear away plates at breakfast; breakfast room a bit too small and cramped; coffee too strong and bitter at breakfast; inconsistent re free coffee/snacks in early evening, & this service was not advertised well; not quite enough cupboard/shelf space for clothes in rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TNJoe
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 3 nights in the Una Hotel. Very nice stay. The location seemed a little remote until we figured out where we were, since there was only a small sign in the window. We stayed in a superior room, which was very nice. Very clean, nice bathroom. No complaints what so ever. Room had a safe in the storage cabinet. Very good breakfast every morning in a very nice dining area. Attendants in the dining area were very quick to get coffee and meet your needs. We arrived middle of the morning and since the hotel was full our room was not empty yet. But they took our luggage into a private room behind the desk where it was locked until we returned. When we returned our luggage was in the room. Staff was very friendly and helpful when we needed directions or a restaurant. Very pleasant stay; no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Fairytale holiday in lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: aquawife
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this hotel as a surprise for a "special" birthday, as I had always wanted to go to Venice. He booked a superior room with a view of the canal, and we couldn't believe how good the room was - large, with tasteful decor, a very comfortable bed and a spacious, immaculate bathroom. The hotel is really quiet, yet only a couple of streets away from the centre. the staff were extremely hepful and friendly, and we really appreciated the little afternoon tea that was available (free if you didn't choose the gateau) when you staggered back from a day's sightseeing. This hotel really helped to make my first visit to Venice special, and I would recommend it wholeheartedly if you want somewhere peaceful, comfortable, clean and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, very convinient”
Reviews.Author: CndnTraveller
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in a quiet area but within step from a main street Strada Nova filled with shops and restaurants. There is 3-5 minutes walk from Ca d'Oro vaporetto stop (line 1) and 5-7 minutes walk to the boat stop which will take you to the airport (takes 40 minutes and leaves once in an hour). By the way a walk to St marc's square doesn't take more than 12-15 minutes along the shop filled streets. A walk to realto bridge is even shorter. Very-very convinient. At hotel I was recommended a restaurant "Al Vecio Bragosso" (3 minutes walk from hotel). This restaurant is a gem - this quality of foods is rarely found in turist areas and prices are not biting at all. I also highly recommend their home made desserts. Reservations are recommended to avoid disappointments as this retaurant gets filled up quickly. hotel is very plesent, clean (I should say "crisp"), has a great breakfast with selection freshly baked breads, cheeses, meats, yogurts...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: GatesheadColdstream
Reviews.Content: Ignore any poor reviews; this is a lovely hotel and only 15 minutes to Piazza San Marco through the interesting streets of Venice. The staff were very helpful and friendly. Rooms were perhaps a little compact as was the breakfast room, but very clean, nicely furnished and comfortable beds. Breakfast buffet was very good. Water buses were good but charge same price for any single journey 6.50 euros. Piazza San Marco very expensive and you need to ask for your change; some have a habit of "forgetting".

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, character hotel in a brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: Sarah_Gough
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel situated a couple of streets away from the main tourist drag, so although you felt you are off the beaten track, you are only a few minutes away from the Rialto bridge. We were impressed with our room (which had a view of the canal if you really craned your neck out of the window) and thought it was tastefully decorated in venetian style. Breakfasts were nice too which were included in the price. Would love to come back to this hotel and shall start hinting to my boyfriend!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in quiet area”
Reviews.Author: Rachel24
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Una Hotel in Venice at the beginning of August. We had wanted to be in the Cannareggio area for its location close to the Ghetto, as well as it being further from the crowds. Based on the Tripadvisor reviews and the hotel pictures we chose the Una Hotel and are so glad we did! We arrived on a hot evening, after a long day of driving. Since we had two toddlers and a lot of luggage, we took a water taxi right up to the hotel which was a great experience. The lobby is light and welcoming, and very cool, coming from the heat outside. Check-in was smooth and the staff was friendly, professional and extremely helpful. We had booked an Executive room as we had been told that this was the size we needed for two cots. It was not very large but tastefully decorated, spotlessly clean and fresh. It had a couch and a little tea table with a kettle and tea/coffee making facilities. The bathroom also wasn't very big, but it was new, lovely and had a bathtub. In general, it was a beautiful hotel in a peaceful, residential area, but within walking distance to all the main attractions. The staff were very polite and helpful - I cannot recommend their service enough!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel, but not the place to be grounded during the ash cloud”
Reviews.Author: helenphoenix
Reviews.Content: Had an amazing attic room with a good deal of 185 euro a night, staying 3 nights. we were stranded by the ash cloud & asked to stay an extra night. We could either pay 350 euro for the same room or downgrade to a lesser room for 250 euro. Needless to say we took the lesser room but after 1 night had to get off the island & stayed on the Lido for 85 euros. We loved the Hotel & the location but didn't much like the fact that they took advantage of our dire situation. Would recommend the hotel but don't get stuck there because you couldn't afford to.

Reviews.Title: “a gem- friendly, very reasonable. incl breakfast”
Reviews.Author: watchful-Ira
Reviews.Content: We loved the place ands its quiet location 3 blocks from a busy mall street and 4 blocks from the main terminal for airport vaporettos which leave every hour during daytime and take 45 minutes to arrive at airport. 2 minor issues: no drawer space for clothes- we left them in suitcase; also, construction started on street near entrance- like a maintenance yard; didn't know what that might lead to.

Reviews.Title: “great quality comfort and location”
Reviews.Author: monalinda2010
Reviews.Content: considering venice is expensive, space is at a premium and the summers are hot and steamy - this was a really nice find. the hotel was elegant and modern. the staff was attentive and professional. the breakfast buffet was abundant and included full italian and english chioces. while the hotel lobby and public spaces were expansive, the room itself was realy really small - but we had a view over a small canal in a quite section of town with good ari conditioning and it was very easy to catch the vaparetto close by - or walk where ever you needed to go. the desk staff were very helpfull with dining choices nearby! richardi

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend”
Reviews.Author: whereisdave
Reviews.Content: Good location- about 10min walk to Rialto bridge, another 10min to St Marks. Just be sure to get directions from the hotel so you know how to find the hotel when you first get to Venice. Room was spotless and modern, bed comfortable, AC. My bathroom was the style where the shower was an enclosed curtain in part of the room, but this was still fine. Some staff members were extremely helpful, others were helpful enough. Hotel can give you a good map. Breakfast was just OK. Price was decent for Venice, I paid about $158/night for my single room- my only complaint is that they charge a fair amount for wireless internet use here.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: jeannie459
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the UNA Hotel Venezia with my daughter as a birthday treat. We had no problem finding the hotel thanks to the information given by a previous visitor. I would recommend copying the directions and taking them with you, as the hotel has no sign on the exterior. The area is ideal, just a couple of streets away from a good shopping, eating area with a lively bar area in the evening. The water bus stop is a couple of minutes walk away and makes a cheap way to get around Venice when you get tired out with all the walking ( take very comfortable shoes) The hotel is situated on a very quiet canal and the interior is very clean. The rooms are stylish and immaculate. We found the staff at reception very helpful. The breakfast was very good with lots of choice including a hot choice. I would definelty stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Seeshell_10
Reviews.Content: The definitely unassuming exterior was worrysome until we walked into a pleasant lobby area with very friendly staff. The room was beautifully decorated with Murano chandeliers and fixtures. The walls were fabric covered and the bathroom was done in marble and granite. We paid for the breakfast which was adequate for Venice in a nice little dining room. The location was not too far off the beaten path especially for taking the water bus to the airport. Just be prepared to carry your luggage over bridges and alleyways. The nearby shopping was touristy with some very nice restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Staff is 50% good & 50% worthless”
Reviews.Author: WhatsamataU
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice but then you are paying for it as the rooms are not cheap. The staff when we checked in was nice and very helpful (young Italian lady) but the staff the next day was completely worthless (Italian man.) We had a problem that he could have helped us with but he was in no mood to lift a finger. Should have gotten his name but didn't bother.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in everyway...”
Reviews.Author: TravellerMalta100
Reviews.Content: I recommend this hotel hands on. Nothing to criticise. Very good location, excellent service and the room was extremely nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “10/10!”
Reviews.Author: Phili22
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of my favourites in Italy. We stayed in a superior double room and it was well worth the splurge! The room was very beautifully decorated ..very luxurious with beautiful furniture and a lovely chandelier. The hotel staff were just wonderful and very very helpful. They had wonderful restaurant recommendations and even organised a lovely walking tour for us. Our stay included breakfast, which was very nice, and we were informed by the staff that the dining room always had snacks and drinks for the guest to have throughout the day. The location was also great... close walking distance to st marks, but far enough out of the tourist hussle and bussle. I would definately recommend this hotel... wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Service, nice hotel but tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: countryfeedback
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked in, the staff were friendly and helpful - offering every assistance with what to see, where to go and how to get there. They gave us a very well designed pocket map and a booklet showing main attracions. The hotel was very clean our room was spotless. But don't expect a large room at least our room was tiny. It was really small for two so did our bed. I am 175 cm length and my feet laid outside the bed. We found the location perfect, and enjoyed walking around Venice. The hotel is very close to main attractions it is in a quiet residential area

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: katedog
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night between our cruise and returning home. We tried to check in early so we could start seeing the city, but our room was not ready. They gladly took our bags, offered the restroom and drinks and gave us a map and detailed points of interest for us to see. Although they said our room would be ready in 30 minutes, we decided just to head out for the day and check in later. When we did return, they had upgraded us to an executive room because we had a lot of luggage. We asked about the water bus for our early morning flight the next day and they not only looked up the schedule for timing, but gave us a detailed map and offered to make us breakfast boxes to take with us since we would miss the breakfast buffet. Overall, the hotel was beautiful, in a great quiet location that allowed us to see the true people of Venice, and in a very convenient location close to the main square and close to the water bus to the airport. What was best about the hotel though was the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay if you can afford it! Bit far from St. Marks”
Reviews.Author: lychee1024
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, great and courteous staff, gorgeous room. I thought location was pretty nice, but a little bit of a walk to St. Mark's Sq. Lots of restaurants and bars nearby. I had a great time in Venice because of this hotel. I do have to say that it's not cheap. All four star hotels are expensive, but this was the most expensive of all the ones we stayed in Italy. I would recommend this place though.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more for the cost”
Reviews.Author: Kingspans
Reviews.Content: Having travelled to Venice myself on a few occasions, I wanted to make it special for my sister who had never been. I booked this hotel online based on its description, photos and location. It had water taxi access which was a plus, the location was great for walking to nearby restaurants (we loved a la Vecia Cavana) and shopping. The reception staff was friendly. The room was large but we expected a canal view, and it was not possible to see the canal unless you leaned out of the window and looked down. In my opinion, the photos were deceiving, as the room was not as luxurious as I thought and given the cost I did expect more. Breakfast was just okay and it was complimentary. The main objection was that the room was uncomfortably hot during the day and we could not get the A/C to go on. After asking at the front desk we were advised that it had been turned off for the season and unless they had multiple complaints they could not turn it back on! The receptionist told us that we would be fine at night as it gets quite cool. Yes, it got cool with the windows wide open; however, the mosquitos were invited in and none of us were pleased about the multiple mosquito bites from head to toe!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel with great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Journey_on_earth
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay in Venice to be close to the visit sites but we knew that a 4* hotel would be expensive. After reading hundreds of reviews on TripAdvisor, we chose the UNA Hotel. It was expensive (per American standards) but we were not disappointed. The staff is welcoming and polite, the rooms are clean and fairly spacious (we had an executive room). The room windows are soundproof but not the door. Thankfully, the guests were discreet. Upon arrival in the room, we noticed that the hairdryer wasn't working and we notified the front desk. In no time, there was a staff member in our room to replace it. The breakfast was even better than expected. There was food for every taste: pastries, cereals, fruits, scrambled eggs, sausages, ham, cheese, jam and even real Nutella! The fruit juices and coffee were fine. The hotel location is great and fairly easy to find, if you follow directions from the hotel web site, but you have to keep your eyes open because there's no hotel sign (beside the UNA logo on the brown banners hanging from the hotel room windows - see attached picture). You can also use Google map. If you stay at the UNA and fly to/from Venice, the Alilaguna boat line is the quickest way (besides water taxi). Every hour, it stops a the "Fondmente Nove" which is a 15 minute walk from the UNA hotel. Tickets can be purchased at the nearby ticket booth. The boat ride is about 45 minutes and the walk from the airport boat stop to the airport departure lounge is about 20 minutes. Public transport tickets can be purchased on line at veniceconnected.com. There's lots, I means LOTS of tourists in Venice, so our word of advice is: get up early and go to popular sites at the opening time (usually 9h00) to beat the crowd and walk away from the crowded area in the afternoon. If you spot a nice restaurant, make reservations or you might have to wait. If you find restaurants too expensive, there's a Billa grocery store on the busy Strada Nova street (towards North), about a 10-minute walk from the hotel. We had brought plenty of mosquito repellent but we didn't really need it. We saw only 2 mosquitoes during our 5-day stay but we would not have left the room windows open. The AC system was working fairly well. So, Venice is worth seeing, if you don't mind the crowds and the Italians speaking all the time ;). And the UNA hotel is definitely a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Just Fine- But a Bit Dull”
Reviews.Author: OrlandoRedhead
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is in the heart of a residential district so if quiet is what you are looking for, the Una delivers. The room was on the small side- not unusual for Venice, but beautifully appointed. There was a dial for the air conditioning but no response when we attempted to use it. Kept the windows open to manage the hot weather and wound up with many mosquito bites! There is only a small reception area - with virtually no sign of life. We had to walk out of the hotel's front door and along the walk to another outside door in order to arrive at the area in which our room was located --- we felt a bit isolated. Aside from the breakfast room there is really nothing much- no bar, no grounds, a small "lounge" area with a computer, and absolutely nothing in the immediate vicinity in terms of a bar or restaurant. Yes - a short walk will get you to a proper street with all amenities but the actual neighborhood in which the hotel sits is quiet as a tomb. So- when you return to your hotel you return directly to your room. It just didn't feel like a "hotel". The staff was professional, friendly and helpful. Breakfast was really nice- a variety each day and even eggs and bacon, which many Venetian hotels do not serve. It was only that the overall experience lacked any sign of life! Would have preferred something a bit more jolly. And frankly, with so few amenities, the price seemed a bit high to us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Service, Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: AussieWhirlwinds
Reviews.Content: This hotel was exquisite and unassuming. The staff were absolutely superb from the moment we walked in. They gave us good advice on directions, where to shop, where to dine and what the best sites to see are on our two day stay. Two days is never long enough in venice and we would loved to have stayed at this hotel longer. The room was beautifully appointed and very large by Venice hotel standards. The UNA hotel is in a very quiet location considering it is only a two minute walk to the busy shopping streets of Canareggio. Walking the labyrinthian streets of Venice is the thing to do as who knows what you will discover if you get lost. If your feet are too tired the UNA hotel is very close to the Vaparetto stop. The directions to the hotel are very clear, however the hotel doesn't have any glaring signs saying 'here we are' so be sure to go through the glass doors which subtly say UNA. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: WerdnaHampshire
Reviews.Content: We spent our honeymoon at the Una Hotel, and would thoroughly recommend it. From the moment we walked in, the staff were friendly and helpful - offering every assistance with what to see, where to go and how to get there. When they discovered we were on our honeymoon they left a bottle of wine in our room with a lovely note. The hotel was spotless, including our lovely room. The breakfast buffet, as others have noted, is very good - with everything you could wish for, whether your preference is for "English" or "Continental". We found the location perfect, and enjoyed walking around Venice. The Rialto is only ten minutes away, and it is a lovely city just to walk and get lost in - stopping for a drink/meal and a people watch whenever you fancy! On arrival, we took the (road) bus to Venice and then a vaporetto to Ca d'Oro. From there it is very easy to find the hotel - just walk up from the vaporetto stop, cross the street and go down one of the alleys opposite. The cross over the bridge and the hotel is the last building to the right, with the entrance round the corner. Going back to the airport we chose the waterbus, which goes once an hour from the north coast a few minutes walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly central”
Reviews.Author: berkshiremick
Reviews.Content: Directions to the hotel on their website were spot on. The room was well appointed, but the screen around the shower was too short, and it was unavoidable to get the floor wet. Breakfast was much more plentiful than might have been expected in a hotel of this size, and the staff were very friendly. What was the real surprise was the almost total lack of sound in the evening. I know that Venice has no cars, but the absence of background noise was almost deafening. This, coupled with the heavy curtains in the hotel room combined to permit one to adjust to the sleeping pattern they actually want, rather than being conditioned to waking when the local noise reaches a certain level - tip - bring an alarm clock. Due to the scale of Venice, this hotel wasn't far (15 minutes walk) from anywhere important. The vaporetto also has stops nearby (Ca D'Oro and Fondamenta Nuovo) that give very different sightseeing experiences.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, quiet with great service”
Reviews.Author: runhack
Reviews.Content: This small, newly renovated gem of a hotel is off the beaten path, located in the residential area of Canareggio, just a short walk from the vaporetto, and only 10 minutes to the major attractions. The area is quiet and lovely, avoiding the crush of the tourist areas, but still readily accessible. The staff is warm, welcoming and accommodating. The rooms are on the small side, as is common in Venezia, but very comfortable and well-equipped.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: DoomedXIII
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights recently and enjoyed it very much. The staff was very helpful and attentive, the room was nicely furnished and the location worked well, less than a 5 minute walk from the Ca'Doro vaporetto stop. We chose this place in part because we had a very early flight out of Marco Polo and needed to get to Pizzale Roma at about 4am for a land taxi. I'm happy to report that this worked out well for us, as the Night vaporetto arrives at Ca'Doro every 20 minutes and gets to P. Roma in about 10. The desk staff very very helpful in giving advice and procuring vaporetto schedules. The room was very quiet but just steps to a main street, Strada Nova, with lots of shops, restaurants and bancomats. The Canareggio district where Una is located is more residential than touristy, which made it very comfortable. It was a bit of a hike to get to San Marco on foot, but it's a magical walk. There was always a logjam around Rialto, but that's to be expected. The room was a nice size, but certainly not huge. The included breakfast was very good, and even featured some hot items like bacon and eggs that our other Italian hotels had not. A canal view might have made this perfect, but otherwise, this is a solid choice!

Reviews.Title: “Great welcome to a very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: jim148
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights overall in Venice, 3 nights in the UNA hotel. The welcome by the receptionist was just great, she gave us lots of information about Venice and the hotels location (which was perfect for visiting, Venice is quite small anyway, so not far from anything). The staff were very friendly and spoke great English, which was good, but meant I couldn't practice my poor Italian :) The room was lovely, beautiful Venetian style up in the loft of the building with the wooden beams on show. The bathroom was a little small, but clean, modern and stylish. Breakfast was good, typical assortment of food, hot and cold. I couldn't of wished for better, a great hotel at a great price. I

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, quiet area, delightful staff, highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: treez1
Reviews.Content: After looking at hotel after hotel after hotel on various websites for my Venice mini-break I turned to my old faithful, trip advisor to help me in my mission. I saw this particular hotel's reviews and pics and thought it sounded ideal, it in fact was! Looking for a decent base in Venice can be tricky and expensive but I can't recommend this hotel enough. We experienced excellent staff, who were really helpful in recommending some great restaurants and were really welcoming. The location is a little out of the way but that's a positive thing considering the "main" parts are so busy and crammed with people you are happy to escape it. It's ideally located also to make trips to the islands, such as Burano/Murano etc as the particular boat stop is no more than 5 minute walk away. Room was excellent, we paid a little more and had an executive double which I would really recommend. We had complimentary bottles of wine to greet us and the room was spacious and super clean. They clean the rooms twice a day and pop a little sweetie treat in the afternoon, very nice touch! The hotel offers afternoon tea (complimentary) every day, there were cakes and wine also to snack on. Would really recommend this hotel, a quiet corner away from the madnes of Venice, bliss.

Reviews.Title: “Fab room, nice quiet location”
Reviews.Author: BaldyB
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for the last two nights of our honeymoon trip through Italy. We got an upgrade to the tower room on the fourth floor which had picture windows covering two walls, one set overlooking rooftops, the other directly above a narrow canal. The room was clean and cosy, with old wooden beams criss-crossing the ceiling vault and deep carpets on the floor. The bathroom was rather small but nicely done. We didn't spend much time exploring the hotel (we were here to see Venice) but what we we saw was all clean and pleasant. The breakfast room was rather cramped and the breakfast staff seemed a bit harried but after eventually getting our coffees the rest of the buffet selection was perfectly adequate (with very nice cakes indeed says my wife...) The staff at reception were good - the woman who checked us in gave us a fantastically warm welcome and some useful sight-seeing tips. The hotel is located in the Cannaregio district which is slightly off the beaten track but feels a lot more genuinely Venetian than some other areas of this most touristy of cities (we read somewhere that the number of tourists in Venice every day outnumbers the number of residents). It took us quite a while to find the hotel, having dragged our suitcases up several wrong turnings on the way from the train station, but that's our fault for trying to rely on the pretty basic map in the Lonely Planet guide. Once we got our bearings it took us under ten minutes to walk to the Rialto and a further ten / fifteen from there to the Piazza San Marco depending on which route we took. (And that's our top tip for Venice - get off the main streets which are jam-packed with slow moving herds of tourists and lose yourself in the back-streets and alleys. Walking back to the hotel on the second night of our stay we seemed to have the place to ourselves, occasionally stumbling on small squares dotted with a lone cafe and fairy-light festooned trees. Lovely.) We paid Â£126 per night B&B. You could probably find somewhere cheaper but for the welcome and the upgrade we were more than happy.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice in Venice”
Reviews.Author: strabaneman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Una Venice last year and found it great so we booked again this year-Im glad to say that we were not disappointed.We were greeted on arrival and after our hot trip on vaporetto line 1 there were complimentary drinks which were much appreciated.The hotel is comfortable,cool andquiet .The staff are friendly and the main sites are easily reached by foot.The breakfast provided is adequate and all round I cant find fault with this hotel.I would certainly recommend it to those who want a relaxing oasis in the heat and hustle that is Venice in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hidden Gem!!”
Reviews.Author: gujji81
Reviews.Content: I cannot praise this lovely 4 star boutique hotel enough.Having taken a train from Rome we took a water taxi(too much luggage!) and arrived at the doorstep of this lovely hotel.I must say I was quite confused even standing outside as there is no mention of the hotel!! As soon as me and my wife arrived we were greeted and WELCOMED which we missed so much in Rome.They upgraded us to an executive room on the ground floor which was nice and spacious and had a lovely view of the canal.The hotel is located on a parallel street to Stradanova which means no noise or disturbance inspite of being 10 steps away from the action!!The rialto bridge and San Marco's square are a charming 10-15 mins walk away through the narrow lanes of Venice. One night upon return the reception staff told us that there was some noise pollution test being carried out in our room and wouldnt take more than 10-15 mins.I cannot tell you how many times the staff apologised for the inconvenience and offered us free champagne and juice in the meanwhile!He even figured out at 11 pm which port our Royal Caribbean ship was going to be docked the next day to arrange a water taxi for us:). I would rate this hotel as the "most desirable address to stay at in Venice".

Reviews.Title: “UNA Hotel Venezia: Just What I Needed!”
Reviews.Author: JackAdvisor
Reviews.Content: I had to go to Venice for a business meeting to be held the following morning. I was tired and a bit annoyed by having to pull my luggage around the "old" streets of Venice. But my tension went away as soon as I reached the lobby of UNA Hotel Venezia (www.epoquehotels.com) where I was greeted with such a warm welcome and a huge smile! The room was excellent as was the breakfast. The location is central, although in a secondary street. Too bad I could saty only one night. I truly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Venice in April”
Reviews.Author: apple41
Reviews.Content: Walking from Pl de Roma in heavy rain the hotel was difficult to find. At reception we waited, tired (it was 11.30 pm) and dripping wet, we waited in silence whilst the reception guy completed the lengthy check-in procedure. He showed us to our room, opened the door, said 'goodnight' and closed the door! We looked around and wondered where the bed was,(I had booked one large room) trying one of two closed doors I was pleased to see the bedroom. Thinking to use room service I looked for the menu card, by now it was 12.15 am we hadn't eaten since midday and room service was not available after 12.00 midnight! It would have been a nice gesture if Reception had mentioned this on our arrival- so off to bed hungry. (there was a box containing snacks on the table - 5 or 6 pralines/ a small amount of peanuts or several other choices at 6 euros each! Bottled water in the mini-bar at 3 euros, this is penny pinching as at breakfast there is champagne freely available - sadly I do not drink alcohol only water. The breakfast was good, as long as you arrived early, cake, croissants, bacon, egg, juice, etc were not replenished if eaten by earlier guests. The waiters were very efficient. Maintenance appeared to be a problem, on return to our room one day during the afternoon the curtains had been closed presumably due to the sun, an arm chair near the window was leaning - one leg was broken - it stayed like that, propped on the broken leg for the rest of my stay. The shower control was loose and fell off several times, the toilet seat was not firmly fixed and felt insecure when in use, the sink and bidet plugs would not raise/lower by use of the lever, there was a large dirty stain across the sitting area floor. Two red flashing alarm lights above the bedroom door flashed constantly - why? There was a TV in each room with Sky - only one English station, the News. My suggestion to UNA Hotels is please teach your reception staff how to welcome guests, especially late on a very rainy Sunday night and show the guests what the many controls are for in their room. When we checked out there were several staff on reception, we were not asked if we had enjoyed our stay (5 nights) The good points are: hotel is very clean, spacious, bed huge, comfortable, kettle, tea/coffee in room and the location is very central. To reach the Hotel from the Grand Canal stop at Ca d'Oro, walk up to Strada Nova, straight across to Calle Delle Vele, over the bridge and the Hotel is on your right. Easy when you know. I have filled in the questionnaire on-line sent to me by UNA Hotels but it would not allow me to make all my comments. This hotel is expensive 1038 euros for 5 nights with breakfast, generally we enjoyed our stay but it would have been better without the above 'niggles'. We could have made our feelings known to the staff - if there wasn't the language barrier. Venice is pricy, pay for the multi-visit ticket when you visit the Churches -you get a map and can visit many churches, same at the museums. Buy the 12 hour or more tickets for the vaporetto, and try to obtain a card for visiting public toilets, they are very clean but priced at 1.50 euros per visit the cost soon mounts up, it is almost more economical to stop for coffee and use the toilet in the cafe. Venice is beautiful, I love the quietness late at night on the Grand Canal, the busyness of the market by the Rialto, the narrow 'streets', the music in St Marks Sq, the canals, I am already planning my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “What an amazing find in Venice”
Reviews.Author: huberdarling
Reviews.Content: We were so amazed by this hotel after staying at one of the UNA Hotel's in Milan. The location is off the beaten path, which we really liked after spending the whole day in the crowds, and the hotel could not be more beautiful. The staff were amazing and extremely welcoming and helpful. We will stay here again when we come back to Venice

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Emma123456_9
Reviews.Content: The Una Hotel Venezia is a fantastic hotel. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Venice. It really is luxurious, and just what you need after a long day sight seeing. It's really centrally located, only 5 min pleasant walk to the Rialto bridge, and a further 5 mins to St Mark's Square. The hotel is located just off a main street, so it's central, but tranquil too. It's a few mins walk from the Cala D'Oro vaporetto stop which is really handy, although it's central enough to see most places by foot. It's handy for nightlife too, and there are a handful of cool trendy bars nearby if you're visiting over the weekend. The breakfast was amazing, and really sets you up for the day. They even have champagne at breakfast! I love the Una brand, and now want to visit all their hotels. This hotel really made our holiday, and it would make yours - it's luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Book Directly on hotel website”
Reviews.Author: humbleinla
Reviews.Content: Hi everyone. My family came to Venice for 3 nights at the height of the Euro's appreciation against the dollar. There were three of us, so I'd like to comment on some of the other concerns and criticisms you might see here. Rooms: if you're looking for a roomy room here, consider springing for at least a superior room (for 2), or an executive room (for 3). I don't know about the B&Bs in Venice, but have enough experience in Mediterranean Europe to know that it's exceedingly rare for the basic room from a major hotel chain to hold even 2 people comfortably. It's sad, but that's life in the big cities, and in Italy, UNA counts as a major chain. Location: we like being able to sleep at night, and we're not big fans of 3 AM urban street noise. If your vision of romantic is looking out upon massive crowds at your window 24-7, there are plenty of well-regarded B&Bs closer to St. Mark's. Otherwise, you'll have a fine rest alongside regular Venetians as your neighbors. And you can still see canals from your window. Price: yes, it's pricey, but at a time when 1 Euro was as much as US$1.80, Venice gave us sticker shock no matter where we looked, even in the rattiest hostel. If you're only 2 people, try 4-5 stars on priceline & hotwire first, but beyond bidding $250/night, forget it! You might get lucky on UNA's website with special offers. We did (for 3 people), and have no regrets, because regular prices at Best Western, Starwood, Boscolo, Hilton, Bauer, or any other 4-5 star chain on the islands are mortifying, regardless of whether you search on Orbitz, Hotels, Expedia, Travelocity, Venere, HolidayCity, etc. So assuming you're not swimming in waist deep Adriatic winter seawater at Christmas time, enjoy Venice. Again, B&Bs are great, but for a full service luxury hotel on a less than astronomic budget, UNA Venezia is REALLY tough to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great room - nice stuff - happy about my choice!”
Reviews.Author: alfonso_paus
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights in the beginning of January 2009 and the experience was really good. We arrived to Venice by train and then took the vaporetto 1 direction LIDO to the Ca d'oro stop. The hotel is just about 150 meters from the station, and if you take a look at the map in the website is really easy to figure out how to get there, so unless you are really lazy do not bother to get a Water Taxi as this is probably really expensive. The room we had was a "Superior Room" we booked through the Una Hotels website for 160â‚¬ a night ( 2 people including breakfast ). The room was really nice, old style but recently renovated with a lovely venetian lamp and with three windows with views to the small channel in front of the hotel ( I think room number was 202 ). I have added pictures of this room. The hotel is at a very quiet location but very close to all of the sights of the city. It takes about 15 minutes to walk to the very center, San Marco square, but I wouldn't advice to get a hotel in the most central areas because the amount of tourists and gift shops take all of the "romantic potential" out of Venice! We found one of the nicest places to visit in Venice just a few blocks from the hotel. The Jesuit Church of the Assumption. Also I would advice you to avoid the San Marco area as much as possible and walk around Dorsodouro, Cannaregio and San polo areas which take less tourists and are much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “A great location”
Reviews.Author: CharlotteCJH
Reviews.Content: The first thing to know about this hotel is that there is also a Hotel Luna! We did not realize this could be confused by a water taxi driver and that we would spend over $100 to get to the wrong hotel only to have to spend the same amount then getting to the correct one! So please be sure you say and even spell "Una!" The hotel is a great location for walking to everything we desired. Much like the rest of Venice, I imagine, every canal, alley and bridge around were just so beautiful. We really enjoyed walking everywhere we went and we found many great restaurants within a very short distance. Our first night, we ate at Algiubagio which we found by mistake searching for one recommended by the hotel. We had AMAZING service there and the food was great. Overall, the hotel was a good landing place. The bath was beautiful and peaceful for a nice hot bath after a rainy travel day. Our room decor and layout was very well done and everything was tremendously clean. The staff at the front desk was very helpful the first night with our taxi issue but on day two when they ran out of umbrellas (we had used one earlier in the day), we had some difficulty getting help. We asked for garbage bags to put on over our clothing as it was pouring outside but the front desk man was not very accommodating. For a rainy trip in Venice, this was a great location. While it seemed pricey in some ways, it was comparable in price to others in Venice. It just isn't an inexpensive destination.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Erpp
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay for my July birthday. Room -- Our room seemed large for a european hotel with a sofa, large closet and bathroom with a tub/shower (all-in-one). Every toiletry imaginable was provided and much appreciated. Location -- We were so grateful that we did not stay in the main tourist area as it was a very, very crowded. After being in the crowds all day, we really enjoyed ending our day in a nearby cafe enjoying a drink before heading to the room to clean up for dinner. That said, the hotel is only a short walk to any of the city attractions. I also really enjoyed shopping in the nearby boutiques and walking to the outdoor market. Breakfast & Food -- Typical cheese, pastries, fruit, cereal, etc. Everything was fresh. We also twice ordered from their limited snack menu. My husband still says it is the best caprese salad he has ever eaten. Staff -- Everyone was friendly and helpful. Also, everyone in the front desk and in the breakfast/snack area spoke English which was really helpful. Complaints/Things to be aware of - Only one: no a/c in the common areas. We were staying during the height of the tourist season we had to be out of our room on time as they were fully booked and expecting guests. Which was no problem at all except we were catching the Orient Express later that afternoon and wanted to stay "fresh" in our suit/dress. Well, it was a particularly hot day and the common areas are not air conditioned. Since we had booked a water taxi to the train station (we splurged in vain to again be fresh) we couldn't leave early with our bags to somewhere with a/c & were stuck in this incredibly hot common room. As it turned out, it really didn't matter b/c the Orient Express also does not have a/c but if I was about to take an intl. flight, it would not have been a very uncomfortable flight....

Reviews.Title: “Venice is fantastic and so was the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AutumnBreeze_8
Reviews.Content: Our flight got us there at around ten at night so we went straight to the water taxi desk at arrivals. It's 95 euros but well worth it to get delivered straight to the hotel door. When we left we got the water bus which was only 24 euros and was only a five minute walk from the hotel. The staff were brilliant and couldn't do enough for us. The room was real luxury and it appears that they upgrade everyone on arrival if the hotel isn't too full. Breakfast was great and a good start to a busy day walking around. Strada Nova (2 minutes from hotel) had some lovely shops including a dog clothes shop. It had a nice local feel. Rialto bridge was just a few minutes further on and San Marco Square 10 minutes further on. It does get cold at this time of year but we got some lovely sunshine too. Out of season Venice is great, not too busy and you get to see all the local Italians...very chic!! DON'T EAT AT THE IGUANA RESTAURANT! It was billed in my book as having live latin music. No music, very cold with just a little heater sitting on a nearby table. The food was also cold when it arrived. Chilli mince beef should surely be thoroughly heated through before serving and the salad was brown with age! However, we did see someone walking a ferret outside so it wasn't all bad. Stay at the Una Hotel Venezia, it just adds to the romance of this wonderful city! PS. We managed to get a ride on a gondola for 60 euro's and he turned out to be an amazing tenor into the bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing after the great reviews on Tripadvisor”
Reviews.Author: The_Saint_is_40
Reviews.Content: We visited the hotel in October 2008 for our honeymoon and chose it after reading all of the great reviews on Tripadvisor. We totally agree with Writerwriter who has left a very accurate summary of this hotel. Dont get us wrong, its fine but the feedback elevates it to a very high rating which may be misleading to some travellers, especially if they travel and stay in decent hotels on a regular basis. On the plus side, the hotel is spotlessly clean, very modern and the staff are very attentive. On the downside, the rooms are not big, we were in an Executive room which I had to query as it was pretty small (but then I guess most rooms in Venice are etc). Breakfast is adequate but cramped (and no tomatoes - in italy...are they mad?) and the coffee room is ludicously small (e.g. if two other couples are in there, you wont get a seat). The hotel has Aircon/Heating but you cannot control this in your room as its on a master control (why would they do this???). Our room was too hot so I contacted reception and was told that there was nothing they could do. Leaving the windows open would be fine as it is very quiet but you will spend most of the night chasing mozzies around your room (even in October!).
