What really dissapointed us was that we booked directly with the hotel and asked them to make it special as it was our honeymoon but they did absolutely nothing for us. I even mentioned this again when querying the room size/type and they still did nothing. Given this was an expensive 5 night stay, it wouldn't have taken much to pop a bottle of prosecco and some chocs in the room for arrival. Mrs T was most unimpressed! At the end of the day if you want a nice small modern hotel in a very quite (but well situated) location (and are happy to spend all of your 'hotel' time in your room) then this will be fine for you. I wouldn't recommend this for honeymooners as its not romantic enough, they do nothing special for you and the lack of a decent bar/restaurant is a real downer as you'll need to go out for a nice drink and a chat etc. If i was to visit venice again I would go for a more lively location and book a larger hotel with a decent restaurant and a bar with some ambiance. Hope this helps paint a realistic picture of this place!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: maroongirl90
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here at the Hotel "Una" (they don't call it by its full name usually) for two nights and really enjoyed this hotel. Everything about it is top notch. The hotel is in a quiet location and therefore slightly off the beaten path, which we liked very much. It is easy to access from the Ca d'Oro vaporetto stop--just 2 quick blocks. Staff is extremely friendly and helpful. Everyone spoke English quite well so communication was easy given our limited but manageable Italian. We got answers to all our questions about directions, places we wanted to visit, and restaurant reservations. The amenities just go on and on. We had an executive room. The linens, the decor, everything was quite luxe. The bathroom was to die for. Great soaking tub that was a godsend after a long day of touring. They provided 2 types of bath salts and numerous other toiletry items, and additionally offered a men's and women's kit separately, that contained moisturizer, manicure kit, face cream, etc. The dining room served breakfast as well as a limited dinner menu (can't recall if there was lunch because we were always out during that time). The dining staff was extremely friendly and professional. The hotel is spotlessly clean and kept up. We arrived in Venice by train and took a water taxi to the hotel because we had quite a bit of luggage and weren't exactly sure where we were going. It cost us 60 euros. You do have to cross one bridge if you take the vaporetto, but in retrospect, I think we could have managed it. We left Venice by air so we took the Alilaguna water shuttle, which is about 8 mins walk from the Hotel Una. You'll have to cross 2 bridges (translation-up and down 4 sets of steps leading to and from those bridges). From the Fondamenta Nuova water stop, it took about 40 mins to get to Marco Polo airport. Just be aware you'll have to lug your baggage another 7 minutes from the place you disembark from the Alilaguna boat, so have some change ready for use of the luggage carts (1 euro) if you gave a lot of luggage. There are a few restaurants in the vicinity of the hotel that we did not check out. All in all, a great hotel we'd highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the UNA”
Reviews.Author: jenglar
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the UNA for 4 nights in mid-October for 10 year anniversary. Used the "Taste of Venice" package which included several extras and booked the 2 level junior suite. Loved this place - great comfort and service. It's nice to have some modern amenities that one misses in a B&B - like coffee in room, etc. The staff was so accomodating and professional - making wonderful restaurant recommendations and helping book them as well, as well as arranging other items. I would highly recommend this hotel and the chain in general.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings - not as good as I had expected”
Reviews.Author: Writerwriter
Reviews.Content: Having read the good reviews of this hotel I was a little disappointed with it. First, the good things. Very clean, well decorated, friendly staff. A stylish feel, in an old arcaded building. They had free tea in the evenings, and tea and coffee making in the rooms. Neutral: Location was quaint and not too far from restaurants and a vaporetto stop but was quite residential and very dead in the evenings. Breakfast ample and varied but quality mediocre - dry scrambled eggs, packets of processed cheese, catering quality yogurt, dull pastries. No coffee shop alternatives handy. Negatives: our room (cheapest price range) VERY small, no room for a bedside table or even shelf on one side. Bathroom stylish but very cramped, no shelves, toilet roll holder too close to use if you were seated on the toilet! I am tall but if I had been obese would have been impossble to use the bathroom. A/c switched off so the stuffy room could not be cooled. We kept the window open but this was so near the bed it caused a draft and mosquitoes came in! The room was VERY dark, and none of the hotel ever got any sunlight. I did not feel like returning to this hotel nor look forward to waking up in it. There was a lot of public space with big wide corridors but nothing was arranged to give guests anywhere comforatble to sit in the evening. The breakfast room doubled as the bar, crammed with dinky tiny tables, the one guest lounge was really tiny & dominated by a silent TV. But the bedroom was too small to sit in comfortably. As a 3 star this would have been OK. As a four star - hm. I know the hotel situation in Venice is difficult but if I'm going to have a tiny room and be uncomfortable I may as well be in the Ai Do Mori whose location is ten times better and it is just as clean.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: Osterlerian
Reviews.Content: On our arrival the hotel apologised for not giving us the "superior" room requested. However, they offered either a partial refund or a restaurant meal on them. We opted for the latter. Room 1 is a bit too small but the only real problem was the rather cramped bathroom. Otherwise we thought the hotel was very good. Our room was clean, extremely quiet, the breakfast was excellent and the staff were very efficient and friendly. We would love to go back

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brockles
Reviews.Content: If you are not familiar with Venice, and arriving by air, I strongly recommend taking a water taxi from the airport (presently priced at EUR 95). This removes all the hassle as your make your entry into this amazing city. You will later become familiar with all the much cheaper and efficient public transport. We travelled back to the airport on the Blue Line ferry. The Una Hotel is tucked away on a small canal halfway between Ca' d'Oro and the north shore of the island. It didn't even have a sign outside! Any doubts we had quickly evaporated as we were met at reception by warm and helpful staff, who provided maps and restaurant information. We booked a Junior Suite. It was of the duplex style, with no less than two full sized bathrooms! The service and cleanliness were both impeccable. The breakfast was excellent. Above all, the staff really made our stay. We walked almost everywhere. The Rialto was about 15 minutes, then another 10 minutes to S. Marco Piazza. Or you could walk to the Ca' d'Oro Vaporetto stop on the Grand Canal (about 5 minutes), buy an unlimited travel pass, then cruise the canal as far as the Lido and back, getting on and off to see the sights. Venice is an amazing city. The Una Hotel is a fabulous place to stay from which to soak it all up, and your feet after a day's walking!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Una Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: SteveDenver_Colorado
Reviews.Content: My wife and I very much enjoyed our stay at the Una Hotel. We had a beautiful, spacious room (book an executive room)overlooking a canal. We originally booked our room through Hotels.com. However, we then went directly to the hotel website and we were able to book a larger room at considerably less cost. The location of the hotel is away from the bustle of St. Marks Square but is easily accessible to all parts of Venice by walking or taking a vaporetto. We found the staff of the Una to be very friendly and helpful at all times. The breakfast was wonderful. When we return to Venice, we will plan to return to the Una.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: mikerigby
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a short 4day/3night stay in Venice staying at the Una Venizia hotel. We found the hotel , the staff , the rooms and general overall quality very good indeed. We have stayed in many hotels around the world so feel confident in recommending this hotel to anyone. Although the hotel was in a quiet area , it suited us and it was only a few minutes walk to many shops and varied types of restaurants. IThe hotel was just a short walk from the Grand Canal for all boat connections around Venice although we found it fantastic to just walk the small streets from the hotel up to St Marks Square area. We really enjoyed the walks around the area . On arrival at the hotel the staff at reception were more than helpful in providing maps and suggestions as to places to visit and things to do during our short stay. Would certainly suggest when arriving at the airport to buy the Venice Card for unlimited travel on the canal boats and it is also valid for the travel into and out of Venice on the bus ( line number 5 ) from Marco Polo airport to Pizalle Roma in Venice . The room we had , which was a junior suite , was excellent and certainly of very good quality both in decor and in the general layout of the room which was on two floors as we had our own stair case in the room so went upstairs to bed each night. We would certainly recommend the hotel to anyone and will be looking to book a stay there again hopefully in the not too distant future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull stay”
Reviews.Author: FBek
Reviews.Content: Great place (Venice), great position (hotel), great room (I chose a superior room), maximum kindness from the staff. Definetly a fantastic experience to live deeply the atmosphere of this city. The Beds are confortable (if you want you can chose from many different pillows) usefull amenities and the concierge manage perfectly any request.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Romance!”
Reviews.Author: jayse21
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Una in Vencice for our wedding anniversary. We booked an executive room which was really lovely. It was spacious, lovely decor and furniture, a comfortable bed, a well equiped bathroom. The seating area was also lovely with a large widescreen tv ( handy for catching some olympic action when we got up) I could not really find fault with the room. There were the extra touches like bathrobes and slippers, lots of cosmetics etc and a hand mini bar ( fridge spacious enough to put our own drinks in.) There was even a pillow menu ( which meant I got to have an extra soft pillow) The service at reception was great, they were helpful and polite staff, excellent English and happy to assist in anyway they could. Breakfast was really nice a huge selection of food in a light and tastefully decorated room, again great service. The lounge area and seating areas around the hotel were also lovely and always spotlessly clean. The hotel location was great. Close to a main street but far enough away by a quiet canal to get no noise in the evenings. It took at most 10 minutes to Rialto, about 15 min to walk to st marks. The local riverbus stop was less than 5 and Fondemente Nove ( convenient for airport and murano trips) is also only about 5 min walk. This is a great choice of hotel for somewhere quiet yet close enough to the action. Rooms are lovely, especially if you can stretch to the ones above the basic level. We hope to return again on our next visit to Venice

HotelInfo.Name: UNA Hotel Venezia
HotelInfo.Address: Ruga Do Pozzi 4173 | Cannaregio, 30121 Venice, Italy
